io.odysz.semantic

Class Semantics

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.odysz.semantic.Semantics

  • public class Semantics
extends Object
    Data structure semantics item description and supporter, e.g. semantics of fullpath is used for depth-first tree traveling.
    TODO should renamed as DB Table relationships?
    Author:
    ody

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Semantics(Semantics.smtype semantic, String[] args)
      semantic = fullpath, args["tabl", "rec-id", "parentId-field", "suffix-field", "fullpath-field"]
      semantic = parentChildrenOnDel, args["parent-table", "parent-id-field", "child-table", "child-fk-field"]
      semantic = dencrypt, args["tabl", "cipher-col", "iv-col", "decrypt-key", "encrypt-key"]
      semantic = opTime, args["tabl", "rec-id", "oper-col", "operTime-col"]
      semantic = checkCountOnDel(sql), args["tabl", "rec-id", "desc-template", "select count-arg0, recName-arg1, ...", "deleting-pk-col"]
      semantic = checkCountOnInsert(sql), args["tabl", "rec-id", "desc-template", "select count-arg0, recName-arg1, ...", "deleting-pk-col"]
      semantic = composed-col = concat(composing-cols), args["tabl", "rec-id", "composed-col", "composing-col1", "'const'", ...]
      semantic = stampUp1ThanDown, args["tabl", "id-field", "up-stamp", "down-stamp"]
      semantic = clob, args["bump-case-tabl", "id-field", "lob-field"]

      String upstampOnInsert(String conn, Object dateStr)
      For null, '0', invalid date string, return "1776-07-04 00:00:00", other wise add 1 second to dataStr.
      String upstampOnUpdate(String conn, String tabl, String recId)
      Get up-stamp on update (increase down stamp).
      Return null if semantics is specified as no up-stamp generating (like on DB that support timestamp on update)

      • Semantics

        public Semantics(Semantics.smtype semantic,
                 String[] args)
        semantic = fullpath, args["tabl", "rec-id", "parentId-field", "suffix-field", "fullpath-field"]
        semantic = parentChildrenOnDel, args["parent-table", "parent-id-field", "child-table", "child-fk-field"]
        semantic = dencrypt, args["tabl", "cipher-col", "iv-col", "decrypt-key", "encrypt-key"]
        semantic = opTime, args["tabl", "rec-id", "oper-col", "operTime-col"]
        semantic = checkCountOnDel(sql), args["tabl", "rec-id", "desc-template", "select count-arg0, recName-arg1, ...", "deleting-pk-col"]
        semantic = checkCountOnInsert(sql), args["tabl", "rec-id", "desc-template", "select count-arg0, recName-arg1, ...", "deleting-pk-col"]
        semantic = composed-col = concat(composing-cols), args["tabl", "rec-id", "composed-col", "composing-col1", "'const'", ...]
        semantic = stampUp1ThanDown, args["tabl", "id-field", "up-stamp", "down-stamp"]
        semantic = clob, args["bump-case-tabl", "id-field", "lob-field"]

      • checkRefereeCount

        public void checkRefereeCount(String connId,
                              String pkCol,
                              String pkv)
                       throws SemanticException
        If the configured sql has a resulting count (with pk-arg select) > 0, throw an SemanticException of message add while configuration.
        Parameters:
        pkCol -
        pkv -
        Throws:
        SemanticException - thrown when semantics-checking(IrSemantics.checkSqlCountOnDel, ...) failed.
